snippet: Japanese I.T. firms’ new focus on English attracts foreign professionals, including Indians.
abstract: Japanese I.T. firms’ new focus on English attracts foreign professionals, including Indians.
lead_paragraph: Avinash Varma, 23, a graduate of the University of Mumbai, joined Japanese company Rakuten, which operates the country’s largest online shopping mall, in 2011. He’s part of a new push by Japanese companies to attract international talent, strong>Miki Tanikawa wrote in The New York Times.

headline.main: Japanese Firms Try New Hiring Strategies
